Row.Text: Government Reforms are devoted to your system of governance. They focus on your [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty.
Diplomacy Reforms are devoted to your international relations. They focus on your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence and [ICON_SPY] Spies.
Education Reforms are devoted to your scientific advancement. They focus on your [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
Economy Reforms are devoted to your economic prosperity. They focus on your [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_SWAP] Trade Routes.
Industry Reforms are devoted to your industrial development. They focus on your [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_WORKER] Workers.
Law Reforms are devoted to your legal structure. They focus on your [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Political Reforms and [ICON_JFD_LEGISLATURE] Legislature.
Military Reforms are devoted to your armed forces. They focus on your [ICON_WAR] Combat Units.
Religion Reforms are devoted to your religious officials. They focus on your [ICON_PEACE] Faith and [ICON_RELIGION] Religion.
Society Reforms are devoted to your social values. They focus on your [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
Welfare Reforms are devoted to your people's well-being. They focus on your [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Executive Reforms regulate the power by which we administer the government.
Our power is bound only by convention.
-50% [ICON_JFD_FACTION_POWER] Power for the dominant Faction after a new Legislature is composed.
Our power is bound by constitution.
+50% [ICON_JFD_FACTION_POWER] Power for the dominant Faction after a new Legislature is composed.
Base 50% Max [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty from Faction opposition.
Factions Reforms regulate the interest groups that constitute our legislature.
Your Legislature is composed based on eight Factions split between diverse interests across all Reforms.
Your Legislature is composed based on two Factions split between interests across all Left and Right Reforms.
Legitimacy Reforms regulate the claims that assert our right to rule.
Our riches asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Market.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Market.
Our strength asserts our right to rule.
Our sagacity asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Library.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Library.
Our justice asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Magistrate's Court.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Magistrate's Court.
Our ability asserts our right to rule.
Our divinity asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Temple.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Temple.
Our popularity asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Stadium.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Stadium.
Our lineage asserts our right to rule.
Our protection asserts our right to rule.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when all cities have a Police Station.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when no city has a Police Station.
Power Reforms regulate the purpose of the power of the government.
Our power is used to enforce order.
-50% toward [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionary Faction Power after a new Legislature is composed.
+50% [ICON_JFD_REVOLUTIONARY_SENTIMENT] Revolutionary Sentiment per opposed [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reforms passed.
Our power is used as we will.
Our power is used for the common good.
-50% [ICON_JFD_REVOLUTIONARY_SENTIMENT] Revolutionary Sentiment per opposed [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reforms passed.
+50% toward [ICON_JFD_FACTION_REVOLUTIONARIES] Revolutionary Faction Power after a new Legislature is composed.
Territory Reforms regulate the extent of the state's organization.
The state is organized with limited territories.
+10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when you control 2 cities or less.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when you control 3 cities or more.
The state is organized with no defined limits.
The state is organized with vast territories.
+20% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when you control 8 cities or more.
-10% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty when you control 7 cities or less.
Succession Reforms regulate how public offices are filled.
Structure Reforms regulate the relationship between cities and the central government.
Our cities act in their own right.
Cities increase the cost of exceeding your [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform Capacity by 25% less.
Cities increase the cost of exceeding your [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform Capacity by 25% more.
Suffrage Reforms regulate the right to vote in political and public elections.
All have the right to vote.
-1% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] needed to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Government Reforms per Citizen (up to 30%).
No one has the right to vote.
Only land owners have the right to vote.
-5% [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] needed to pass [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Government Reforms per City (up to 30%).
Analysis Reforms regulate the nature of our law-making advisors.
Basis Reforms regulate the core principles that inform our laws.
Constitution Reforms regulate the formal enshrinement of our essential laws.
The constitution lies in various laws.
-10% min. [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms.
The constitution lies in a single document.
+10% min. [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms.
Equity Reforms regulate the extent to which the law applies to all.
The law is applied equally to all.
-10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in non-occupied cities.
The law is not equally applied to some.
+10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in non-occupied cities.
Judiciary Reforms regulate the institution that oversees our laws.
The judiciary and government are seperate.
Cities increase the cost of exceeding your [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform Capacity by 25% less.
+10% min. [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms.
The judiciary is an arm of the government.
-10% min. [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms.
Cities increase the cost of exceeding your [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform Capacity by 25% more.
Justice Reforms regulate the ultimate purpose of the application of the law.
The law seeks to redeem criminals.
The law seeks merely to punish criminals.
The law seeks to deter criminals.
Legislature Reforms regulate the relationship between the executive and the legislature.
The executive and legislature are conjoined.
Faction Support decreases the minimum [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms by 25% more.
Faction Opposition increases the minimum [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms by 25% more.
The legislature is not formally distinct.
The legislature and executive are separate.
Faction Opposition increases the minimum [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms by 25% less.
Faction Support decreases the minimum [ICON_JFD_SOVEREIGNTY] Sovereignty needed to pass Political Reforms by 25% less.
Record Reforms regulate the publication of government documents.
Only personal government records are kept.
Government records are kept in private.
Rights Reforms regulate entitlements to fundamental freedoms.
Rights inherent in humanity are protected.
+15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness is needed to begin a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.
Rights inherent in nature are protected.
Rights inherent in our laws are protected.
-15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness is needed to begin a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.
System Reforms regulate the precedent by which our laws are constituted.
Laws are based on juridicial discretion.
Laws are based on pre-established codes.
+5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Government and Reform Buildings.
Alliances Reforms regulate how we secure our city-state alliances.
We secure our alliances through diplomacy.
+15% [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from completing Quests for City-States.
We secure our alliances through treaties.
We secure our alliances through marriage.
+15% [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from completing Diplomatic Missions with City-States.
+15% [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from completing Diplomatic Missions with City-States.
Embassies Reforms regulate the nature of our diplomatic embassies.
We seek peace with our embassies.
We seek to relations with our embassies.
We seek power with our embassies.
Gifts Reforms regulate our diplomatic offerings to other powers.
We send jewels as gifts to other powers.
We send no gifts to other powers.
We send slaves as gifts to other powers.
+15 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence from Combat Unit gifts made to City-States.
Ideology Reforms regulate our approach to our and opposing ideologies.
We seek to proliferate our ideology.
+15% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to civilizations that have less [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
-15% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to other civilizations that share your Ideology.
We do not act on our ideology.
We seek to safeguard our ideology.
+15% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to other civilizations that share your Ideology.
-15% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to civilizations that have less [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Intelligence Reforms regulate the focus our espionage operations.
Our spies focus on gathering others' secrets.
Our spies do as they are needed.
Our spies focus on protecting our secrets.
Interests Reforms regulate our diplomatic interests in lesser powers.
Our interests are motivated by commerce.
+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for International Trade Routes with City-States.
Our interests are motivated by diplomacy.
Our interests are motivated by power.
+2 [ICON_INFLUENCE] per turn with City-States you have an International Trade Route with.
Precedence Reforms regulate the order in which other civilizations are treated.

Set.Text: Diplomatic effect from your Precedence Reforms.

Row.Text: Civilizations with whom you share the same Government like you more.
Civilizations with whom you don't share the same Government dislike you more.
They like that you have the same Government system as them.
They dislike that you have a different Government system as them.
Civilizations against whom you have more cities like you much more.
Civilizations against whom you have less cities dislike you much more.
They like that you have more cities than them.
They dislike that you have less cities than them.
Representatives Reforms regulate our diplomatic representatives.
Our representatives are go where needed.
We do not have formal representatives.
Tribute Reforms regulate the offerings that we demand from our lessers.
We demand gold as tribute from our lessers.
We demand food as tribute from our lessers.
World Reforms regulate our integration into the international system.
+10% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism for shared religion, trade routes, and open borders.
We remain neutral to the world.
We seek to preserve our independence.
-10% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism for shared religion, trade routes, and open borders.
Charters Reforms regulate the focus of the right to form companies.
Charters are issued for commercial ventures.
Charters are issued for colonial ventures.
Currency Reforms regulate the medium by which goods and services are exchanged.
Economics Reforms regulate the means by which the economy is determined.
The economy is set by the market.
The economy is set as needed.
The economy is set by the government.
Infrastructure Reforms regulate the maintenance of roads and railroads.
-1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for all Units starting their turn on a Road or Railroad.
+1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for all Units starting their turn on a Road or Railroad.
Monopolies Reforms regulate the permittance of resource monopolies.
Ownership Reforms regulate the right to the ownership of property.
Property can only be naturally owned.
Relations Reforms regulate the organization of economic relations.
Taxation Reforms regulate the rate of taxes excised from our population.
Tax is set at low levels.
-10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in non-occupied cities.
Tax is set at normal levels.
Tax is set at high levels.
+10% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in non-occupied cities.
Trade Reforms regulate government intervention in international trade.
Trade is unrestricted to foster commerce.
+10% toward all Yields from International Trade Routes.
Trade is directed for government interests.
Trade is restricted to foster equity.
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections to the Capital.
Wealth Reforms regulate the means by which wealth is distributed.
Wealth is distributed through the market.
Wealth is distributed through the palace.
Funding Reforms regulate the focus of public funding toward higher education.
Honours Reforms regulate the fields that we especially recognise.
+15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Cultural Great Person rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
+15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Magistrate rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
-15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Scientist rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
+15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Scientist rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
-15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Cultural Great Person rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
-15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Magistrate rate during [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages.
Information Reforms regulate the freedom of access to scientific information.
Access to information is strictly controlled.
Instruction Reforms regulate the values that are imparted in our schools.
Learning Reforms regulate those that serve as centres of learning.
Universities are primary centres of learning.
The Palace is the primary centre of learning.
Monasteries are primary centres of learning.
Research Reforms regulate our approach to international research.
-15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from expending Great Scientists for Technology.
+15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from expending Great Scientists for Technology.
+15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gained from expending Great Scientists.
Scholarship Reforms regulate the nature of the scholarship that we promote.
We promote scholarship in the arts.
Schooling Reforms regulate those has access to state schooling.
All have equal access to schools.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for every 4 non-Specialist Citizens in all cities.
Only the elite have access to schools.
Only those with merit have access to schools.
Scribes Reforms regulate the focus of the record-keeping of our scribes.
Our scribes focus on recording philosophy.
Our scribes focus on recording history.
Our scribes focus on recording mathematics.
Training Reforms regulate the nature of the education our people receive.
Architecture Reforms regulate the nature of our architectural projects.
Construction Reforms regulate the focus of our construction efforts.
Employment Reforms regulate the relationship between employers and employees.
Environment Reforms regulate the industrial useage of nature.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] and -1 [ICON_FOOD] from Forest, Jungle, and Atoll Tiles.
The use of nature is unregulated.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] and -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] from Atolls, Forests, and Jungles.
Guilds Reforms regulate the focus of the issuing of guild charters.
Guild charters are issued for merchants.
Guild charters are issued for artisans.
Industries Reforms regulate the ownership of important industries.
Labour Reforms regulate the rights of workers to their own labour.
Workers are free to sell their labour.
Workers must contribute labour to the state.
Workers are bound to the land they serve.
Machinery Reforms regulate the focus of the useage of machines.
Manufacturing Reforms regulate the means by which manufacturing is conducted.
Unions Reforms regulate the organization of workers around their trade.
Trade Unions are organized by the state.
Command Reforms regulate how commanders in our army are selected.
Commanders are selected based on merit.
Commanders are trained up from soldiers.
Conquests Reforms regulate the administration of captured subjects.
Captured cities are co-opted to work alongside us.
-15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Population in occupied cities.
Captured cities are subject to our authority.
Captured cities are assimilated into our own.
+15% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from Population in occupied cities.
Defenses Reforms regulate the focus of our defensive interests.
We focus our defenses on our cities.
-15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Units when fighting in friendly territory.
-25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Units when stationed on a Fort.
-15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in friendly territory.
-25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when stationed [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]on a Fort[ENDCOLOR].
We focus our defenses on our lands.
+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Units when fighting in friendly territory.
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Units when stationed on a Fort.
+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when fighting in friendly territory.
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when stationed [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]on a Fort[ENDCOLOR].
Logistics Reforms regulate the means by which our armies are provisioned.
Our army takes what it needs by looting.
Our army takes what is given to them.
Payment Reforms regulate the pay that we give to our soldiers.
Soldiers receive lodgings in lieu of pay.
Soldiers receive lands at the end of service.
Recruitment Reforms regulate how new soldiers are recruited into our armies.
Soldiers Reforms regulate the kinds of soldiers that constitute our armies.
Our army is filled with mercenaries.
Our army is filled with citizens.
Our army is filled with slaves.
Strategy Reforms regulate our strategic considerations in the international sytstem.
We seek to deter against threats.
+2 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence per turn with City-States you could demand tribute from.
We seek to ensure our survival.
We seek to compel our interests.
Technology Reforms regulate the focus of our military science advances.
We focus on having a tactical advantage.
We focus both on a tactical and technical advantage.
We focus on having a technical advantage.
Warfare Reforms regulate the manner in which we conduct war.
War is conducted at a distance.
Authority Reforms regulate the highest authorty on religious matters.
The church is the highest religious authority.
Religious authority is a private matter.
The state is the highest religious authority.
Church Reforms regulate the status of the institution that administers our dominant faith.
The church is a cultural institution.
The church is an independent institution.
The church is a national institution.
Inquisition Reforms regulate the nature of inquisitions against heresy.
Heresies are processed by legal means.
Heresies are processed by military means.
Investiture Reforms regulate the authority that invests religious offices.
The church appoints its own leaders.
Missions Reforms regulate the focus of our missionary works.
+1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Missionaries starting in friendly territory.
-1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Missionaries starting in foreign territory.
Missionary work is conducted in private.
+1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Missionaries starting in foreign territory.
-1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Missionaries starting in friendly territory.
Offerings Reforms regulate the offerings we make to our faith.
We offer prayers for our faith.
We make no offerings for our faith.
We offer sacrifices for our faith.
Orders Reforms regulate the nature of religious societies.
+5 Unit HP per turn in own borders.
This unit [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heals 5 Additional HP[ENDCOLOR] per turn when [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Inside of Friendly Territory[ENDCOLOR].
+15% [ICON_STRENGTH] Strength in foreign lands for Units purchased with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Politics Reforms regulate the participation of religion in politics.
Religion does not participate in politics.
+4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each World Religion with at least 1 follower in all cities.
+4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each World Religion that has at least 1 follower.
All religions may participate in politics.
Only our religion may participate in politics.
Ritual Reforms regulate the administration of religious rituals.
Teachings Reforms regulate the nature of our reception to religious teachings.
Missionaries can spread their religion one extra time.
Teachings are mixed with local beliefs.
Citizenship Reforms regulate the balance between the rights and duties of citizens.
Language Reforms regulate the status of language used in government.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for every 4 non-Specialist Citizen in all cities.
Heritage Reforms regulate the status of historic cultural sites.
Heritage sites are exhibited to the public.
Heritage sites belong to their community.
Marriage Reforms regulate the institutional nature of partnerships.
Media regulates the ownership and freedom of the media.
All media is controlled by the state.
Memorials Reforms regulate the focus of our monumental dedications.
Memorials are dedicated to our soldiers.
Memorials are dedicated to our leaders.
Patronage regulates the focus of government support for the middle classes.
Peerage regulates the legal status of hereditary titles.
Publications regulates the freedom to publish creative content.
Status Reforms regulate the nature by which people are organized.
Development Reforms regulate the focus of our socio-economic development.
+10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections with the Capital.
-10% [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Domestic Trade Routes.
We focus on the capital's development.
+10% [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from Domestic Trade Routes.
-10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connections with the Capital.
Equality Reforms regulate social and economic inequalities amongst people.
+25% of excess [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness added each turn to [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
People are ensured what is naturally owed.
+15% [ICON_FOOD] Food is stored after population growth in all cities.
Festivals Reforms regulate the administration of public festivals.
Festivals are administered by the state.
Goods Reforms regulate the nature of the provision of public goods.
Build Aqueducts, Gardens, Watermills, and Hydro Plants 15% faster.
Healthcare Reforms regulate the provision of healthcare services.
Healthcare is provisioned by the state.
Poor Reforms regulate the status of and provisions for the poor.
Employment is provisioned for the poor.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for every 4 non-Specialist Citizens in all cities.
The poor are treated as criminals.
Housing is provisioned for the poor.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 4 non-Specialist Citizens in all cities.
Rations Reforms regulate the nature and provision of rations.
Work is distributed to people in need.
Nothing is distributed to people in need.
Food is distributed to people in need.
Security Reforms regulate the provision of economic security.
Wages Reforms regulate the imposition of limitations on wages.
Wages are capped at a maximum.
Wages are raised to a minimum.
Works Reforms regulate the nature of building projects.
